identificationModule.briefTitle: Desflurane Versus Propofol in the Sitting Position
identificationModule.officialTitle: International Review Board of Gachon University Gil Hospital

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The investigators hypothesized that both propofol and desflurane would decrease the regional oxygen saturation (rSO2) but propofol is likely to reduce rSO2 more than sevoflurane when patients are raised to the sitting position.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The investigators hypothesized that both propofol and desflurane would decrease the rSO2 but propofol is likely to reduce rSO2 more than sevoflurane when patients are raised to the sitting position. Therefore, the purpose of this study was to investigate the effect of desflurane and propofol on rSO2 values during the beach chair position for shoulder arthroscopy.

armGroups.label: Desflurane
armGroups.description: anaesthesia was induced with thiopental sodium 2 mg kg-1, alfentanil 10 μg kg-1 and rocuronium 0.6 mg kg-1. Anesthetic maintenance by desflurane

armGroups.label: propofol
armGroups.description: anaesthesia was induced with the effect-site concentration of propofol 5.0 μg ml-1, alfentanil 10 μg kg-1, and rocuronium 0.6 mg kg-1. A commercially available target controlled infusion (TCI) pump (Orchestra®, Fresenius Vial, France) was used and the pharmacokinetic set used to calculate target effect-site concentrations for propofol was Schnider and colleagues' model

interventions.name: propofol
interventions.description: anaesthesia was induced with the effect-site concentration of propofol 5.0 μg ml-1 mainly.

interventions.name: alfentanil
interventions.description: administration of alfentanil 10 μg kg-1 for anesthetic induction

interventions.name: Rocuronium
interventions.description: administration of rocuronium 0.6 mg kg-1 for anesthetic induction

primaryOutcomes.description: definitive values of regional cerebral oxygen saturation(rSO2,%) values are described as mean (SD)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1, 3, 5, 7, and 9 min after the beach chair position

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Forty patients,
* ASA class I or II,
* undergoing shoulder arthroscopy

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients with history of cerebrovascular disease, coronary occlusive disease and/or obesity (body mass index \> 30) were excluded from this study.

participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: March 2011-August 2011 in Gachon University Gil Medical Center, who underwent arthroscopic shoulder surgery

outcomeMeasures.title: Regional Cerebral Oxygen Satuation (rSO2)
outcomeMeasures.description: definitive values of regional cerebral oxygen saturation(rSO2,%) values are described as mean (SD)
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: A power analysis was calculated based on a previous study.14 In each group, 16 patients were needed to detect a mean intergroup difference of 5% in the rSO2 value with a power of 80% and a type I error of 0.05. To compensate for a dropout rate of 20%, 40 patients were included in this study.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: 1, 3, 5, 7, and 9 min after the beach chair position

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: 1, 3, 5, 7 and 9 min after the sitting position and postoperative 24hours

eventGroups.title: Desflurane

limitationsAndCaveats.description: limitations of this study is that the ventilation was adjusted according to ETCO2 value instead of the arterial carbon dioxide tensions (PaCO2).
